sentence: Salesforce.com ( CRM ) saw its IBD SmartSelect Composite Rating rise to 96 Friday, up from 93 the day before.
[ibd-display-video id=2368044 width=50 float=left autostart=true] The revised score means the stock currently tops 96% of all other stocks in terms of key performance metrics and technical strength.
The best stocks tend to have a 95 or better grade as they kick off a significant move.
Salesforce.com is now out of buy range after breaking out from a 98.32 buy point in a flat base.

The stock sports a 98 EPS Rating, which means its recent quarterly and annual earnings growth is outpacing 98% of all stocks.
Its Accumulation/Distribution Rating of D shows moderate selling by institutional investors over the last 13 weeks.
Look for the rating to improve to at least a C or better.
The company posted 63% earnings growth for Q3.
It has now posted accelerating EPS gains for two consecutive quarters.
Top line growth fell to 25%, down from 26% in the prior quarter.
